Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants that look healthy and are growing when they have water.
The student can draw plants that are not healthy and are not growing when they do not have water.
The student can show plants that are in the light and appear healthy.
The student can indicate how plants in dark places do not grow well.
The student can use drawings to show that patterns, like the need for water and light, affect whether plants can live and grow.
